tool.name: Check for 2 SAM files -
tool.description: verify have 2 SAM files for every 1 FASTQ file.

param.name: alnType
param.label: Align Type
param.help: Select single end or paired end alignments

param.name: sam1
param.label: SAM G1
param.help: Select SAM G1 file used in sam compare script

param.name: sam2
param.label: SAM G2
param.help: Select SAM G2 file used in sam compare script

param.name: G1
param.label: Tester
param.help: Enter the name of the tester, G1

param.name: G2
param.label: Line
param.help: Enter the name of the line, G2

tool.help:
**Tool Description**
This tool checks to make sure that **2 SAM files** were generated from **1 FASTQ file** Each FASTQ file is aligned to the updated G1 genome AND to the updated G2 genome.
**NOTE:** If you are running the BASE workflow without modification all reads are aligned as SE - select SE
**Inputs**
(1) The FASTQ file used to generate the SAM files (2) Select how the FASTQ file was aligned - this will be SE if running the BASE workflow (3) The unique SAM file generated by alignment to G1 followed by parsing. (4) The unique SAM file generated by alignment to G2 followed by parsing. (5) The name of the G1 genome (6) The name of the G2 genome
**Output**
(1) A single TSV file containing information on whether 2 SAM files were present or not.
